attributes.action: Increase the grant for full electric vehicles
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/plug-in-car-grant-changes-to-grant-level-november-2018/upcoming-changes-to-the-plug-in-car-grant

https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/car-news/104868/plug-in-car-grant-axed-for-phevs-and-cut-for-electric-cars

“After the change in rates, the grant rates will be as follows:

The grant rate for Category 1 vehicles will move from £4,500 to £3,500.

Category 2 and 3 vehicles will no longer be eligible for the grant.”
attributes.background: The future of transport is electric. Because they produce less pollution, cause less health problems in cities and can be powered by free renewable energy the government provide grants to buy them. However rather shortsightedly the DfT and OLEV have announced a reduction in the amount of said grant.
